info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 14 at 9:39PM CDT until September 14 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Bismarck ND
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of north central North Dakota, including the following counties, south central Bottineau, western McHenry, southeastern Renville and southeastern Ward.
* WHEN...Until 1145 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 937 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated that 2 to 4 inches of rain fell with earlier thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional significant rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Velva, Granville, Upham, Denbigh, Karlsruhe, Norwich, Voltaire, Bantry, Bergen and Simcoe. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away.
Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT THIS EVENING
